resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.

fields.summary: euca-describe-nodes, euca-describe-components output inaccurate in certain topologies
fields.environment:
*non-HA*

* CLC, Walrus
* CC, SC
* 1 x NC

comments.body:
Setup several 3.4 and 3.3.1 systems with the topology
CLC Walrus
CC SC
NC

When setup, euca-describe-nodes always shows the NC

Hey [~ethomas],

*Updating Question*

Question - when you set up the topologies, did you use Managed/Managed-NOVLAN where the CC's VNET_PRIVINTERFACE was different than the VNET_PUBINTERFACE when you tested 3.3.1? I wanted to see what the root cause of the issue was in 3.3.1.  I tested this on 3.4.x and I am not seeing this issue either.

[~ethomas],

Ah ok.  Understood.  Thanks man for the response and confirming this has been fixed in 3.4.x.
